page.title: 15 The Village Shop.
page.content:
The widespread use of the motor{car for individual travel has meant that people are no loger confined to their immediate area as they used to be. It is difficult to realise now that before this century the fastest means of{transport}was the{train}and before that the{horse. }A choice now exists for people to shop where they please and the larger towns with bigger and more competitive shops attract the customers from miles around.
The two{shops}in the block surveyed are typical of the local amenities competing for survival and forming consortia to gain better wholesale prices. Emphasis is on service and the small shopkeeper is finding it increasingly difficult to survive. Local{Post Offices}are closing or under threat.
